thread.title: Australia: Sydney to Host Netball World Cup

author: Michael Taylor
title: Australia: Sydney to Host Netball World Cup
text:
Australia: Sydney to Host Netball World Cup 
Sports 
A total of 16 national teams will vie for the championship of the 14th edition of the Netball World Cup, which will take place in Sydney, Australia, from 7 to 16 August 2015 . Austrlian netball fans show their colours. Photo Credit: Australia Government, Department of Health. 

Sixteen national teams will compete in the 14th edition of the Netball World Cup, which will be held in Sydney, Australia, from 7 to 16 August 2015. 
The following nations will compete in a total of 64 netball matches: Australia, Barbados, England, Fiji, Jamaica, Malawi, New Zealand, Samoa, Scotland, South Africa, Trinidad and Tobago, Singapore, Sri Lanka, Uganda, Wales, and Zambia 
The 16 teams will be divided into 4 pools, with the top-ranked teams guaranteed to go head-to-head in the preliminary rounds. 
All of the netball matches will be held at Sydney Olympic Park. 
This will be the first time Australia has hosted international netballâ€™s pinnacle event since 1991, when Michelle den Dekker captained her home team to a famous 53-52 victory over New Zealand in what was then known as the World Netball Championships. 
Talking Points 
Have you ever played netball? What do you think of it as a sport?
